column4: I'm suffering from iowait problems. Right now I'm partitioning a 500GB USB drive and iowait is up to 100%, system load is 5-6.. is this really normal?
It isnt one of those passports is it
It isnt one of those passports is it       .as in what make and model of drive
oh, the drive is a Western Digital MyBook and the system is running Ubuntu 8.04 server edition
I seem to remember they had some "Feature" you had to use windows machine to turn off.. you might need to google it as not many will know
im suffering from iowait problems even when cping files on the regular local sata drives
ah.. different issue if internals are the same.. even with the external unplugged?
haven't tried disconnecting the usb drive, will that make any sense?
I know those drives have caused issues and it would be worth a quick look
but the problem might have started when I first plugged in the drive actually
tracker may be sucking up your cycles too.
no
will it harm the disk?
it cant do it any good.. leave it for a bit and then kill it if you must
it has been left for quite some time now iowait still at max and it doesn't seem to finish
do what you have to do...  and also check google on a power saving feature etc on that drive
Personally, I would try to shutdown the system and hope it did less damage
okay, hmm
kill -9 doesn't seem to have any effect, the process is still there
reboot doesn't even seem to be enough to get the system down ;)
I wish I had an answer
I know, i'll go for the hard reset now, brb
